InitialCrashDefault: ^Patrick."I better FIND AND PLACE THE MISSING WHEEL and fix the broken tire"
CarWheel: ^Patrick."I'll check around if I can FIND A WAY TO FIX THE TIRE"
ToraChat1: ^Tora.“Welcome to the Fountain of Memories, traveler.”
^Tora.“This town has been abandoned since long ago, when the fountain broke.”

s: ^“Do you know where I can find a tire?”

c-0: ^Tora.“No one in this town is a real person, we’re just ghosts of our past selves, longing to revive the town.”
c-1: ^Tora.“No matter what you seek, traveler, if you don’t want to become a memory like us, you’ll have to fix the fountain. But if a tire is what you’re looking for, Nudo, the farmer, may help you.”
c-2: ^Tora.“It’s- no one really knows… It’s been so long ago…”
g-0: ^Tora.“I wish I could offer you a warm welcome, but there’s little a memory can do.”
^Tora.“Would you be so kind as to… fix the fountain? Or you’d rather just- abandon us, too?”

ToraDefault1: ^Tora.“You should find Nudo in the bar, the building over there.”
BarChat1: ^Barman.“A real human,” he says. “You’re not from here haha, welcome to Sander’s. I would serve you something, but- I can’t really, can I?”

s: ^“I would really do with a warm cup of milk.”

g-0: ^Barman.“So, what brings you to my humble little bar?”

s: ^“Do you know where I can get a tire?”

c-2: ^Barman.“Nudo? He was here just a few minutes ago along with Anton, complaining about how much his back was hurting him, but he left again to finish some work at the farm. The farm is south-east of here.”
c-3: ^Barman.“Nudo may help you with that. He was here just a few minutes ago along with Anton, complaining about how much his back was hurting him, but he left again to finish some work at the farm. The farm is south-east of here.”

NudoFarmChat1: ^Nudo.“Hey there, fella, you’re not from here, are ya?”
^Nudo.“Don’t sweat it, we didn’t use to care much about outsiders, thousands of people came every year to see and taste the fountain… But now, it’s all dust and weed, and forgotten memories…”
^Nudo.“You see that field over there? I used to work it all by myself. But nowadays, I can’t even keep the undergrowth away.”
^Nudo.“Would you be so kind as to help me with it, please? You, young people, are always so full of energy, it shouldn’t take you too long.”

s: ^“I just came to ask you for a tire.”
^“Sure thing, but do you have an extra tire to lend me?”

g-0: ^Nudo.“A tire? Yea, I do have a few spare ones. Finish the field and I’ll give you one.”
^Nudo.“Well well, you did a great job. You remind me of my son, he was just as skinny as you, and he still could work from dawn ‘til dusk.”

s: ^“Could you now give me the tire?”
^“I’m glad I could be of help.”

c-3: ^Nudo.“You reminded me of many things I thought I had lost, thank you.”

g-1: ^Nudo.“Huh? Oh, you need a different tire? a bike tire?”

s: ^“N-no, for a car, a car tire.”

c-4: ^Nudo.“For that, you’ll have to visit Anton, the chess player. He lives just to the left of the fountain, I think he had a car.”
c-5: ^Nudo.“For that, you’ll have to visit Anton, the chess player. He lives just to the left of the fountain, I think he had a car.”

NudoFarmDefault1: ^Nudo."Anton lives just to the left of the fountain."
AntonHouseChat1: ^Anton.“I spent all my life fighting for these trophies and teaching other people how to play.”
^Anton.“But once the time to leave came, I couldn’t bring myself to take them, and at the same time, I couldn’t let myself to leave them.”
^Anton.“It was as if they belonged here, in this small town, and nowhere else. They stayed in my place.”
^Anton.“Would you play one last game with me?”

g-0: ^Anton.“All you have to do is capture my King with your Knight. My Rooks and Bishops will move in the same pattern every time you move your Knight.”
^Anton.“The townspeople are sick of playing against me, hehe, so I’m glad you’re up to the challenge.”
^Anton.“Oh- I think I forgot my pieces at the bar… Would you be so kind as to bring them back, please? With this age, my knees hurt for any small movement, and walking all the way there again…”

AntonDefault2: ^Anton."The pieces should be somewhere in the bar."
BarChat2: ^Patrick.“Yes, he asked me to help him with the farm.”
^Barman.“Haha, that’s Nudo for you, always making other people help out.”
^Patrick.“But he wasn’t able to help me out.”
^Barman.“So, he doesn’t have a tire, then? How strange…”
^Patrick.“No, he did give me one, but it was a tractor tire.”
^Patrick.“Do you know anyone else who may have an extra car tire?”
^Barman.“Not really. Tora is the one who knows everything around here.”
^Patrick.“She told me that Nudo may have one, but I guess she was wrong.”
^Patrick.“The chess player? Not yet. Actually, I was looking for his chess set, he seemed very eager to play a game with me.”
^Barman.“Yeah, poor Anton is like that, always looking for a new partner to play with. He hasn’t been able to play new people since the chess club here in town closed.”
^Barman.“His pieces should be on that table over there, just pick them up.”
BarmanDefault3: ^Barman.“The pieces should be on that table over there, just pick them up.”
AntonHouseChat2: ^Anton.“You found them, thank Goodness. Let’s play, then.”
^Anton.“Ah, the memories… How I missed this, playing against a new friend, thank you.”
^Patrick.“Em… Anton, would you, by any chance, have an extra car tire I can borrow?”

^Anton.“A car tire… No, I don’t think I have one. You see, I left town in my car, like everyone else. I’m not sure if any car was left behind. Tora was the last one to leave, she should know if any car was left behind.”
^Anton.“The poor thing blames herself for the death of the town.”

c-0: ^Anton.“Her father was the only doctor in town, and when he died… the person responsible for the maintenance of the fountain and a few others left town. Tora found herself alone, accompanied only by the fountain. She rejected everyone’s help.”
c-1: ^“I doubt that. She’s a good kid, it was an accident. Things break, people die, and memories get forgotten, that’s the way of life.”

^Anton.“Her father was the only doctor in town, and when he died… the person responsible for the maintenance of the fountain and a few others left town. Tora found herself alone, accompanied only by the fountain. She rejected everyone’s help.”
g-0: ^Patrick.“How sad… it must have been tough for her.”
^Anton.“Maybe you should try asking Fionna about an extra tire, her partner’s car could have been left behind.”
^Anton.“You can find her in the northwest of town, in the chicken coop.”

FionnaChat1: ^Patrick.“Hi, I was looking for Fionna, would you know where I can find her?”
^Fionna.She smiles. “Yes, it’s me, Tora was looking for you.”
^Fionna.“Yes, you. I can tell you where to find her, but first, can you help me out with the chicken? I have been all day trying to catch them, but they’re as playful as their owner.”

s: ^“I guess I don’t have another option, do I?”

c-0: ^Patrick.“You said they are as playful as their owner, who’s their owner?”
g-0: ^Fionna.“It was… Claire, my late wife. She died of sickness when I was on a business trip. If I only stayed with her, I could have taken her to the doctor.”
^Fionna.“It was after, that’s why Tora- well, never mind.”

c-2: ^Fionna.“I- I rather not say. You should ask Tora herself.”
c-3: ^Fionna.“If I told you now, you’d run away from me, wouldn’t you?”

g-1: ^Fionna.“Help me out with the chicken and we’ll talk about Tora’s whereabouts so you can ask her.”
^Patrick.“Yea, but I came here to ask you a different questi-”
^Fionna.“No buts, time to catch some chicken.”
^Fionna.“Claire would thank you with an apple pie. I’m not that good with cooking, so I’ll answer your questions as promised.”

s: ^“Do you have an extra car tire?”

c-4: ^Fionna.“She’s in the viaduct, east of town. She often goes there to visit her father’s tomb.”
c-5: ^Fionna.“A car tire? No, I don’t have one, but Tora should know where you can find one. Didn’t she tell you yet?”

FionnaDefault1: ^Fionna."Oh, these damn chicken won't stay still."
